title: Biology Club
short: Lab-based biology experiments and research clubs.
description: Hands-on experiments and biology research projects led by faculty supervisors. Hands-on biology experiments, laboratory research projects and faculty-guided investigations; students develop lab techniques, research literacy, and present findings at school events.

title: English Club
short: Practice and improve English language skills through activities and presentations.
description: A student-led club focusing on English conversation, debates, and presentations. Members practice real-world communication and public speaking. Student-led club for English conversation, debates, presentations, and public speaking; develops communication and presentation skills through workshops, debates, and performance activities.

title: Environmental Science Club
short: Environmental projects, fieldwork and sustainability initiatives.
description: Students work on sustainability projects, environmental monitoring and community outreach. Environmental Science Club leads sustainability projects, field monitoring, and community outreach to promote environmental stewardship and practical conservation skills.

title: Hack Club — Gharbiya Chapter
short: Hands-on web & app development, competitive programming, and project work.
description: The Gharbiya Hack Club provides students with practical, mentor-led coding projects focused on web development, competitive programming, and app development. Located at the Gharbiya STEM School campus, the Gharbiya Hack Club provides a way for high school students to learn programming and build practical projects. The club focuses on web development and includes departments for competitive programming and app development. Self-learning supported by mentors who assign tasks, quizzes and provide individual feedback.

title: IYNA — Gharbiya Chapter
short: International Young Naturalists activities and chapter events.
description: IYNA - Gharbiya Chapter organizes nature-based projects, outdoor learning and community science initiatives. IYNA Gharbiya Chapter runs nature-based projects, outdoor learning, and community science initiatives, engaging students in fieldwork, conservation, and citizen-science projects.

title: Mathematics Club
short: Problem solving, math circles and contest preparation.
description: Weekly sessions focused on olympiad-style problems, proof techniques, and collaborative problem solving. Weekly math sessions focusing on problem-solving, olympiad-style challenges, proof techniques, and collaborative problem circles to improve reasoning and competition preparation.

title: Physics Club
description: Physics demonstrations, experiments, and preparation for physics competitions. Physics Club hosts demonstrations, hands-on experiments, and training for physics competitions; members explore concepts through practical activities and problem-solving sessions.

title: Robotics Club
description: Design and build robots, learn electronics and control systems, and participate in competitions. Designs and builds robots, learns electronics, programming, and control systems; prepares teams for robotics competitions and showcases through iterative prototyping.

title: U.S. Counseling Club
short: Guidance and counseling activities for students.
description: Offers peer counseling, workshops and college/career guidance sessions. Offers peer counseling, workshops, and college/career guidance sessions; supports student wellbeing, study skills, and transition planning through structured meetings and resources.

title: Fab Lab Team
short: Fabrication lab team working on maker projects.
description: Fab Lab supports prototyping, 3D printing, and hands-on manufacturing projects for student teams. Fab Lab manages campus prototyping and digital fabrication—3D printing, laser cutting, CNC and electronics workshops—supporting student prototypes and maker projects.

title: Meilleurs Team
description: Meilleurs is a student team focused on competitive programming, algorithmic thinking, and collaborative engineering projects. Student competitive programming team focusing on algorithms, contest training, and collaborative engineering projects to develop problem-solving and coding proficiency.

title: MUN Team
short: Model United Nations team focused on debate and diplomacy.
description: MUN represents students in simulation conferences to build diplomacy, research and public-speaking skills. Model United Nations team that prepares students for simulation conferences focusing on diplomacy, research, policy writing, and public speaking skills.

title: TEDx Team
short: Organizes TEDx-style talks and speaker events.
description: The TEDx team curates speaker events, workshops and community talks to share ideas worth spreading. Organizes TEDx-style talks, speaker coaching, and community events to showcase student and local speakers, storytelling, and public-speaking development.
